intro: Hexadesmia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Hexadesmia boliviensis is often found in rocky soils and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation to extreme climates.
